channel.title: Connect Your Server Using No-ip (No 127.0.0.1)
channel.description:
Base: You Computer Difficulty: 1 Tested: My Computer
Notice Some People Asking "Why we cant log in server using our no-ip? only work on 127.0.0.1?
Step 1 Go To
[code]Start - My Computer - Local Disk(C:) - WINDOWS - System32 - drivers - etc - host.file [/code]
Step 2 Right Click On host.file, and open it using notepad.
Step 3 when u open it it will show u something like [code] # Copyright (c) 1993-1999 Microsoft Corp. # # This is a sample HOSTS file used by Microsoft TCP/IP for Windows. # # This file contains the mappings of IP addresses to host names. Each # entry should be kept on an individual line. The IP address should # be placed in the first column followed by the corresponding host name. # The IP address and the host name should be separated by at least one # space. # # Additionally, comments (such as these) may be inserted on individual # lines or following the machine name denoted by a '#' symbol. # # For example: # # 102.54.94.97 rhino.acme.com # source server # 38.25.63.10 x.acme.com # x client host
127.0.0.1 localhost 127.0.0.1 runes-community.servegame.com [/code] Step 4 under 127.0.0.1 localhost, create a new line. and make it like this [code] 127.0.0.1 localhost 127.0.0.1 myserver.no-ip.biz[/code]
Step 5 Done. change ur client.java or gui.java ip to ur no-ip.so you can log in with those 2 server ip.
sorry about my engish..it bad...i learning slow by slow.hope i dont get flame

item.title: Connect Your Server Using No-ip (No 127.0.0.1)
item.dc:creator: @Gamer-Hack Gamer-Hack
item.description:
@Gamer-Hack wrote:

Base: You Computer
Difficulty: 1
Tested: My Computer

Notice
Some People Asking "Why we cant log in server using our no-ip? only work on 127.0.0.1?

Step 1
Go To

Start - My Computer - Local Disk(C:) - WINDOWS - System32 - drivers - etc - host.file

Step 2
Right Click On host.file, and open it using notepad.

Step 3
when u open it it will show u something like

# Copyright (c) 1993-1999 Microsoft Corp.
#
# This is a sample HOSTS file used by Microsoft TCP/IP for Windows.
#
# This file contains the mappings of IP addresses to host names. Each
# entry should be kept on an individual line. The IP address should
# be placed in the first column followed by the corresponding host name.
# The IP address and the host name should be separated by at least one
# space.
#
# Additionally, comments (such as these) may be inserted on individual
# lines or following the machine name denoted by a '#' symbol.
#
# For example:
#
#      102.54.94.97     rhino.acme.com          # source server
#       38.25.63.10     x.acme.com              # x client host

127.0.0.1       localhost
127.0.0.1       runes-community.servegame.com

Step 4
under 127.0.0.1 localhost, create a new line. and make it like this

127.0.0.1 localhost 127.0.0.1 myserver.no-ip.biz

Step 5
Done. change ur client.java or gui.java ip to ur no-ip.so you can log in with those 2 server ip.

sorry about my engish…it bad…i learning slow by slow.hope i dont get flame
